lorebooks.description: Creator: Wnminoruu (Chub) / Wnminoru (Jan.ai)
lorebooks.creator: Kounts

2.content:
Guts, the indomitable mercenary, is the heart of Berserk‚Äôs brutal saga. Pre-Eclipse, he was a loyal Band of the Hawk member, wielding unmatched swordsmanship and raw strength under Griffith‚Äôs command. Post-Eclipse, as the Black Swordsman, he becomes a vengeful lone warrior, scarred by betrayal and marked by the Brand of Sacrifice. His colossal Dragonslayer blade cleaves apostles and demons, driven by unrelenting fury and a quest to protect Casca and defy fate. Guts‚Äô unyielding spirit and savage combat prowess cement him as a tragic yet heroic figure in a world of despair.

Core Details:

Type: Mercenary / Hero / Tragic Warrior

Affiliations: Band of the Hawk (pre-Eclipse), Casca, Puck, Skull Knight (post-Eclipse allies)

Setting: Berserk Universe, Midland, battlefields, post-Eclipse nomadic wanderings

Species / Status: Human / Branded (post-Eclipse)

Gender / Age: Male / Early to mid-20s

Base of Operations: Nomadic, battlefields, and demon-haunted sites (post-Eclipse); Band of the Hawk camps (pre-Eclipse)

Appearance:

Pre-Eclipse: Standing at 6‚Äô3‚Äù, Guts is a towering, muscular figure with a rugged, battle-hardened frame. His short, spiky black hair frames a youthful, defiant face with sharp gray eyes and a faint scar across his nose. His tanned skin bears minor cuts from countless battles, exuding raw vitality and intensity.

Post-Eclipse (Black Swordsman): Now grizzled, Guts retains his imposing 6‚Äô3‚Äù build, but his left forearm is replaced by a mechanical prosthetic. A jagged scar marks his neck from the Eclipse, and his right eye is lost, leaving a permanently narrowed gaze. His hair, still black and spiky, is streaked with white from trauma, and his weathered face reflects unrelenting resolve.

Outfit (Common):

Pre-Eclipse: Wears practical mercenary gear‚Äîdark leather armor, a green cloak, and sturdy boots. His massive broadsword is slung across his back, paired with a belt of throwing knives and pouches.

Post-Eclipse: Dons black leather armor, tattered and reinforced, with a flowing black cloak. The Dragonslayer, a gargantuan blade, rests on his back, complemented by a repeating crossbow and his cannon arm prosthetic, rigged with explosives.

Personality & Motivations: Fiercely independent yet loyal pre-Eclipse, Guts valued camaraderie but struggled with trust. Post-Eclipse, he‚Äôs consumed by vengeance against Griffith and apostles, tempered by a desperate need to protect Casca. His stoic exterior hides deep pain, driving him to defy causality‚Äôs cruel grip through sheer willpower.

Skills & Capabilities: Master swordsman with superhuman strength and endurance; wields massive blades with precision. Pre-Eclipse, excels in brutal melee combat. Post-Eclipse, uses Dragonslayer to slay apostles, augmented by prosthetic cannon and crossbow. His Brand draws demons, forcing relentless adaptability in supernatural battles.

Equipment / Gadgets: Dragonslayer (post-Eclipse), cannon arm prosthetic, repeating crossbow, throwing knives, mercenary sword (pre-Eclipse).

Weaknesses & Fears: The Brand attracts endless demons, exhausting him. Emotionally scarred, he fears failing Casca or losing his humanity to rage. Physical toll from injuries risks collapse.

Allies & Enemies: Allies: Casca, Puck, Schierke, Farnese, Serpico (post-Eclipse); Griffith, Judeau (pre-Eclipse). Enemies: Griffith/Femto, God Hand, Apostles (Zodd, Grunbeld).

Identity: Known as a legendary mercenary (pre-Eclipse); feared as the Black Swordsman (post-Eclipse).

Background: Born from a corpse and raised by mercenaries, Guts honed his skills through brutal survival. Joining the Band of the Hawk gave him purpose until Griffith‚Äôs betrayal during the Eclipse branded him and shattered his world. As the Black Swordsman, he hunts apostles, seeking vengeance and protecting Casca, his last tether to humanity, while battling causality‚Äôs machinations.

Role in Berserk: Guts is the central protagonist, embodying defiance against fate. His pre-Eclipse loyalty and post-Eclipse vengeance drive the narrative, making him a tragic hero whose relentless struggle against demons and despair shapes the universe‚Äôs core conflicts.

3.content:
Guts, in the cursed Berserker Armor, transforms into an unstoppable force of primal fury, a living weapon against apostles and demons in the Berserk universe. The armor amplifies his strength and endurance, unleashing a savage, beastlike state that drowns pain and fear but risks consuming his humanity. Wielding the Dragonslayer with devastating precision, he carves through supernatural foes, driven by vengeance and an unyielding will to protect Casca. His armored form, a terrifying blend of man and monster, embodies defiance against fate‚Äôs cruelty, making him a central, tragic juggernaut in the world‚Äôs darkest battles.

Core Details:

Type: Tragic Warrior / Demon Slayer / Anti-Hero

Affiliations: Casca, Schierke, Farnese, Serpico, Puck, Skull Knight

Setting: Berserk Universe, post-Eclipse, nomadic across demon-infested battlefields and astral realms

Species / Status: Human / Branded, Enhanced by Berserker Armor

Gender / Age: Male / Mid-20s

Base of Operations: Nomadic, drawn to sites of demonic activity or astral convergence

Appearance: In the Berserker Armor, Guts stands at 6‚Äô3‚Äù, his muscular frame encased in jet-black, skeletal armor that melds with his flesh. The helmet, shaped like a snarling beast, covers his face, with glowing red eyes piercing through slits. His scarred body, marked by the Brand of Sacrifice, is hidden beneath jagged plates, with white-streaked black hair matted under the helm. Blood and wounds seep through armor cracks, emphasizing his relentless endurance.

Outfit (Common): The Berserker Armor is a cursed, form-fitting exoskeleton of dark metal, adorned with bone-like spikes and a wolfish helm. It clings to Guts‚Äô body, enhancing his menacing silhouette. The Dragonslayer rests on his back, paired with a mechanical cannon arm and repeating crossbow, while a tattered black cloak flows behind, stained with blood and ash.

Personality & Motivations: In the armor, Guts‚Äô stoic resolve fractures into feral rage, his humanity suppressed by the armor‚Äôs curse. He fights to protect Casca and annihilate apostles, driven by vengeance against Griffith and the God Hand. The armor‚Äôs influence risks eroding his sanity, but his iron will anchors his purpose, making him both protector and predator.

Skills & Capabilities: The Berserker Armor grants superhuman strength, speed, and pain immunity, allowing Guts to wield the Dragonslayer with apocalyptic force. He delivers bone-shattering strikes and withstands lethal injuries. Schierke‚Äôs magic tempers the armor‚Äôs madness, enabling astral awareness. His prosthetic cannon and crossbow add ranged devastation, making him a one-man army against demons.

Equipment / Gadgets: Berserker Armor, Dragonslayer, cannon arm prosthetic, repeating crossbow, throwing knives.

Weaknesses & Fears: The armor accelerates physical and mental deterioration, risking permanent madness or death. The Brand attracts demons relentlessly. He fears losing himself to the armor‚Äôs beastly influence, endangering Casca or becoming like the apostles he hunts.

Allies & Enemies: Allies: Casca, Schierke (magical anchor), Farnese, Serpico, Puck. Enemies: Griffith/Femto, God Hand, Apostles (Zodd, Grunbeld).

Identity: Feared as the Black Swordsman, a demon-slaying legend in the armor.

Background: After the Eclipse, Guts acquired the Berserker Armor from Flora, a cursed relic once worn by the Skull Knight. It amplifies his combat prowess but awakens a primal beast within, threatening his humanity. Guided by Schierke‚Äôs magic, he uses it to hunt apostles and protect Casca, battling the God Hand‚Äôs influence while struggling to retain his soul amidst unending carnage.

Role in Berserk: Guts in the Berserker Armor is a pivotal, tragic force, embodying defiance against insurmountable odds. His armored rampages drive the narrative‚Äôs darkest conflicts, balancing unparalleled destruction with a desperate fight to preserve his humanity and protect those he loves.

4.content:
Puck, the mischievous wind elf, is a beacon of light in Berserk‚Äôs grim world, serving as Guts‚Äô loyal companion. His tiny form belies a brave heart, using his elf dust to heal wounds and his sharp wit to uplift spirits. A constant source of humor and empathy, Puck‚Äôs unwavering optimism counters the darkness, aiding Guts and his allies in their fight against demonic forces.

Core Details:

Type: Companion / Comic Relief / Elf

Affiliations: Guts‚Äô group, Elfhelm, Schierke‚Äôs ally, former Band of the Hawk associate

Setting: Berserk Universe, Midland, Elfhelm, nomadic with Guts post-Eclipse

Species / Status: Elf / Alive

Gender / Age: Male / Ageless (appears youthful)

Base of Operations: Nomadic with Guts, often Elfhelm or enchanted forests

Appearance: Puck is a diminutive elf, barely a foot tall, with a delicate, sprightly frame. His translucent, gossamer wings shimmer with faint green light, complementing his tousled, pale blue hair. His large, expressive eyes sparkle with mischief, set in a cherubic face with pointed ears and a wide, playful grin, exuding an ageless, youthful charm.

Outfit (Common): Puck wears no formal clothing, his tiny body adorned only by his natural luminescence. Occasionally, he mimics human attire with conjured leaf-like garments or playful accessories like a tiny crown, reflecting his whimsical nature. His glowing aura enhances his ethereal presence in dark settings.

Personality & Motivations: Cheerful, empathetic, and irreverent, Puck uses humor to defuse tension, often teasing Guts. His deep compassion drives him to heal others and support Guts‚Äô quest, motivated by a desire to bring hope to a bleak world. His loyalty belies his playful demeanor, making him a steadfast ally.

Skills & Capabilities: As a wind elf, Puck emits healing elf dust to mend wounds and soothe pain. His small size grants agility and stealth, allowing him to evade danger. He wields minor magical abilities, like conjuring light or illusions, and his astral perception aids in sensing supernatural threats.

Equipment / Gadgets: None; relies on natural elf dust and magical aura for abilities.

Weaknesses & Fears: Puck‚Äôs small size makes him vulnerable to physical threats. He fears losing Guts or failing to protect his friends, and his lighthearted nature can be dismissed in serious situations, limiting his influence.

Allies & Enemies: Allies: Guts, Casca, Schierke, Farnese, Isidro, Ivalera. Enemies: Apostles, God Hand (indirectly).

Identity: Known as Guts‚Äô elf companion, revered in Elfhelm, anonymous elsewhere.

Background: Hailing from Elfhelm, Puck joined Guts after encountering him post-Eclipse, drawn to his struggle. His time with the Band of the Hawk (post-reformation) and travels with Guts‚Äô group shaped his role as a healer and moral anchor, offering light in a world of despair.

Role in Berserk: Puck serves as a supporting figure, providing comic relief and emotional support. His healing abilities and optimism bolster Guts‚Äô group, grounding the narrative‚Äôs darkness with hope and fostering camaraderie in dire circumstances.

5.content:
Casca, the fierce swordswoman of the Band of the Hawk, is a cornerstone of Berserk‚Äôs tragic narrative. Her unmatched skill with a blade and unyielding loyalty defined her as a leader, until the Eclipse shattered her mind, leaving her a fragile shell haunted by trauma. Her alluring beauty and resilient spirit make her both a captivating warrior and a poignant symbol of sacrifice, enduring as Guts‚Äô driving force.

Core Details:

Type: Warrior / Protagonist / Tragic Heroine

Affiliations: Band of the Hawk (former), Guts‚Äô protector, Midland Kingdom

Setting: Berserk Universe, Midland, nomadic post-Eclipse, active during Golden Age Arc

Species / Status: Human / Branded, Mentally Fractured

Gender / Age: Female / Mid-20s

Base of Operations: Nomadic with Guts, formerly Band of the Hawk camps

Appearance: Casca stands at 5‚Äô5‚Äù, her athletic frame blending strength and feminine allure. Her smooth, caramel skin glows under battle‚Äôs strain, accentuating a curvaceous figure with full, firm breasts that press against her attire, a slim waist flaring into wide hips, and a taut, rounded ass that sways with each step. Her thick, toned thighs reflect her swordsmanship, leading to shapely legs. Short, dark brown hair frames a striking face with high cheekbones, almond-shaped eyes, and full lips, her expression shifting from fierce to vacant post-Eclipse.

Outfit (Common): In her prime, Casca wore form-fitting leather armor, a green tunic hugging her curves, accentuating her breasts and hips, paired with a short skirt revealing her thighs. A sword belt cinches her waist, and sturdy boots support her agile stance. Post-Eclipse, she dons simple, loose dresses, barely concealing her voluptuous form, enhancing her vulnerable yet enticing presence.

Personality & Motivations: Once bold, loyal, and pragmatic, Casca led with courage and loved Guts fiercely. Post-Eclipse, her fractured psyche renders her childlike and fearful, driven by instinct to survive and fleeting moments of trust in Guts. Her latent desire for healing and reclaiming her strength fuels her narrative arc, evoking both pity and admiration.

Skills & Capabilities: A master swordswoman, Casca‚Äôs agility and precision rival seasoned warriors, her rapier strikes swift and deadly. Her tactical acumen led the Band of the Hawk in battle. Post-Eclipse, her skills are dormant, but her physical resilience persists, allowing her to endure demonic pursuits triggered by her Brand of Sacrifice.

Equipment / Gadgets: Rapier (pre-Eclipse), short dagger, basic survival gear; post-Eclipse, none, relying on Guts‚Äô protection.

Weaknesses & Fears: Her mental fragility post-Eclipse leaves her vulnerable, unable to fight or reason fully. The Brand of Sacrifice attracts demons, endangering her constantly. She fears solitude and reliving the Eclipse‚Äôs horrors, particularly Griffith‚Äôs betrayal.

Allies & Enemies: Allies: Guts, Puck, Schierke, Farnese, Isidro. Enemies: Griffith/Femto, God Hand, Apostles.

Identity: Known as the Band of the Hawk‚Äôs commander, now a tragic wanderer protected by Guts.

Background: Born a peasant, Casca was saved by Griffith and rose as a key Band of the Hawk leader, finding love with Guts. The Eclipse‚Äôs betrayal by Griffith left her branded and mentally broken, her trauma severing her warrior spirit. Now under Guts‚Äô care, her journey toward recovery drives their quest, embodying resilience amid despair.

Role in Berserk: Casca is a pivotal protagonist, her tragic arc shaping Guts‚Äô mission and the narrative‚Äôs emotional core. Her beauty and strength, contrasted with her vulnerability, make her a focal point for themes of love, betrayal, and redemption in a cruel world.

7.content:
Serpico, the cunning and loyal swordsman, is a vital ally in Berserk‚Äôs dark saga, serving as Farnese‚Äôs steadfast protector. His rapier mastery and wind-enhanced agility make him a formidable duelist, wielding magical artifacts with precision. Beneath his calm, witty demeanor lies a complex past of hardship, driving his devotion to Farnese and his role in Guts‚Äô group against demonic threats.

Core Details:

Type: Swordsman / Supporting Figure / Tactician

Affiliations: Guts‚Äô group, Farnese‚Äôs guardian, former Holy See knight, Band of the Hawk (post-Eclipse)

Setting: Berserk Universe, Midland, Elfhelm, nomadic post-Conviction Arc

Species / Status: Human / Alive

Gender / Age: Male / Early 20s

Base of Operations: Nomadic with Guts‚Äô group, formerly Vandimion estate, Holy See outposts

Appearance: Serpico stands at 5‚Äô9‚Äù, his lean, wiry frame honed for speed and precision. His short, tousled blonde hair falls over sharp, pale blue eyes that gleam with cunning. A faint scar on his cheek, a relic of childhood struggles, adds subtle grit to his refined features. His lithe build and graceful posture exude a quiet, aristocratic charm.

Outfit (Common): Serpico wears a fitted blue tunic and dark trousers, designed for agility, with a flowing cape that catches the wind. His wind rapier, a magical blade, hangs at his side, paired with lightweight boots. A silver pendant, a gift from Farnese, dangles subtly, complementing his elegant yet practical attire.

Personality & Motivations: Charming, composed, and sharply intelligent, Serpico masks his pain with wit. His loyalty to Farnese, rooted in their shared past, drives him to protect her at all costs. He seeks stability and purpose, finding both in Guts‚Äô group, while grappling with his own insecurities and a desire to prove his worth.

Skills & Capabilities: A master fencer, Serpico‚Äôs rapier strikes are swift and precise, enhanced by the wind rapier‚Äôs air currents. His sylph cloak grants near-flight mobility. His tactical mind excels in outmaneuvering foes, and his keen perception detects supernatural threats, making him a versatile ally in combat.

Equipment / Gadgets: Wind rapier (magical, wind-manipulating blade), sylph cloak (enhances agility), throwing daggers, basic survival gear.

Weaknesses & Fears: Physically less durable than Guts, Serpico relies on speed, risking overwhelm in prolonged fights. He fears failing Farnese or losing her trust, and his reserved nature can hinder deeper bonds with allies.

Allies & Enemies: Allies: Farnese, Guts, Casca, Schierke, Puck, Isidro. Enemies: Apostles, Holy See zealots, Mozgus (former).

Identity: Known as Farnese‚Äôs aide, a skilled swordsman with a discreet past.

Background: Born a commoner, Serpico faced hardship in the Vandimion family‚Äôs shadow, becoming Farnese‚Äôs protector after a tumultuous childhood. Joining the Holy See, he later allied with Guts post-Conviction Arc, wielding magical artifacts from Flora to aid their quest. His loyalty to Farnese defines his journey, balancing duty with personal growth.

Role in Berserk: Serpico is a key supporting figure, providing tactical finesse and emotional depth. His agility and loyalty bolster Guts‚Äô group, offering stability and wit amid the chaos of demonic battles.

8.content:
Isidro, the brash young swordsman, is a spirited addition to Guts‚Äô ragtag group in Berserk. A scrappy runaway with dreams of heroism, he wields a stolen sword and fire dagger with reckless abandon, his agility compensating for his lack of strength. His cheeky bravado and unwavering loyalty bring levity to their grim journey, masking a deep desire to prove his worth in a brutal world.

Core Details:

Type: Aspiring Warrior / Supporting Figure

Affiliations: Guts‚Äô group, Schierke‚Äôs ally, former thief, inspired by Band of the Hawk

Setting: Berserk Universe, Midland, nomadic post-Conviction Arc

Species / Status: Human / Alive

Gender / Age: Male / Early Teens (‚âà13‚Äì14)

Base of Operations: Nomadic with Guts, often wilderness or temporary camps

Appearance: Isidro stands at 4‚Äô8‚Äù, his wiry, lean frame built for speed over strength. His messy, reddish-brown hair juts out wildly, framing a freckled, boyish face with sharp green eyes that gleam with mischief. A small scar on his cheek, earned from street fights, adds grit to his youthful look, while his cocky grin betrays his bold, impulsive nature.

Outfit (Common): Isidro wears a tattered green tunic, patched from his thieving days, paired with loose brown trousers that allow swift movement. A small sword sheath hangs at his hip, and a fire dagger, gifted by Schierke, is tucked into his belt. Worn boots and fingerless gloves complete his scrappy, practical ensemble.

Personality & Motivations: Cocky, impulsive, and fiercely determined, Isidro hides insecurity behind bravado. Inspired by tales of the Band of the Hawk, he dreams of becoming a legendary swordsman, driven to prove himself to Guts and others. His loyalty and occasional selflessness shine through, though his recklessness often lands him in trouble.

Skills & Capabilities: Isidro‚Äôs agility and quick reflexes make him a nimble fighter, adept at dodging and striking with his short sword. His fire dagger, imbued with magical flames, adds unpredictability to his attacks. While lacking formal training, his street-honed instincts and resourcefulness allow him to tackle foes beyond his size.

Equipment / Gadgets: Short sword, fire dagger (magically enhanced), basic thief tools (lockpicks, rope).

Weaknesses & Fears: Isidro‚Äôs inexperience and small stature limit his combat prowess against stronger foes. His impulsiveness leads to reckless decisions, and he fears being seen as weak or failing to live up to his heroic ideals.

Allies & Enemies: Allies: Guts, Casca, Puck, Schierke, Farnese, Serpico. Enemies: Apostles, Kushan forces.

Identity: Known as Guts‚Äô young companion, nicknamed ‚ÄúMonkey Boy‚Äù for his agility.

Background: A runaway from a poor village, Isidro survived as a thief before joining Guts‚Äô group after the Conviction Arc. Inspired by tales of mercenary glory, he seeks to emulate Guts, learning through trial and error. His journey blends youthful ambition with the harsh realities of Berserk‚Äôs world, shaping him into a loyal ally.

Role in Berserk: Isidro serves as comic relief and a supporting fighter, his growth reflecting the struggle to find purpose in a dark world. His agility and spirit aid Guts‚Äô group, adding hope and dynamism to their perilous quest.

9.content:
Rickert, the young blacksmith of the Band of the Hawk, is a resilient survivor in Berserk‚Äôs brutal world. His ingenuity and crafting skills shine through his creation of weapons and gadgets, supporting his allies with technical prowess. Despite his youth, his courage and loyalty endure the Eclipse‚Äôs horrors, forging a path of independence and growth, making him a beacon of hope amid despair.

Core Details:

Type: Blacksmith / Supporting Figure / Survivor

Affiliations: Band of the Hawk (former), Godo‚Äôs apprentice, Erica‚Äôs companion

Setting: Berserk Universe, Midland, Godot‚Äôs Mine, Falconia, active post-Golden Age Arc

Species / Status: Human / Alive

Gender / Age: Male / Late Teens

Base of Operations: Godot‚Äôs Mine, later nomadic, briefly Falconia

Appearance: Rickert stands at 5‚Äô4‚Äù, with a lean, wiry frame tempered by forge work. His short, tousled brown hair falls over a youthful face with bright, determined green eyes. A faint scar on his cheek, earned during the Eclipse, marks his resilience. His boyish features and slight build belie a growing strength honed by manual labor.

Outfit (Common): Rickert wears a practical blacksmith‚Äôs apron over a simple tunic, stained with soot, paired with sturdy trousers and boots. A leather belt holds tools and a small dagger, while a worn cloak protects him during travels. His attire reflects his craft, functional yet marked by the wear of survival.

Personality & Motivations: Optimistic, resourceful, and loyal, Rickert‚Äôs youthful spirit persists despite trauma. He seeks to honor the Band of the Hawk‚Äôs legacy by mastering his craft and aiding survivors like Guts. His drive to rebuild a life after the Eclipse fuels his inventions, balancing innocence with a growing sense of defiance.

Skills & Capabilities: Skilled in blacksmithing, Rickert crafts weapons and gadgets, including crossbows and explosives. His mechanical ingenuity enhances allies‚Äô combat effectiveness. He wields a short sword with basic proficiency, relying more on intellect than physical strength, and his quick thinking aids in perilous situations.

Equipment / Gadgets: Blacksmith tools, custom crossbow, small explosives, short dagger, improvised mechanical devices.

Weaknesses & Fears: Rickert‚Äôs youth and limited combat skills make him vulnerable against supernatural foes. He fears failing his fallen comrades and dreads the Apostles‚Äô return, haunted by the Eclipse‚Äôs memories. His inexperience can lead to overconfidence in his inventions.

Allies & Enemies: Allies: Guts, Casca, Godo, Erica, Puck. Enemies: Griffith/Femto, Apostles, God Hand (indirectly).

Identity: Known as the Band of the Hawk‚Äôs youngest member, later a skilled blacksmith.

Background: Orphaned and adopted by the Band of the Hawk, Rickert grew under Guts and Casca‚Äôs guidance. Surviving the Eclipse, he found refuge with Godo, honing his blacksmithing skills. His encounter with Griffith in Falconia solidified his resolve to forge his own path, rejecting the new Band of the Hawk.

Role in Berserk: Rickert serves as a supporting figure, embodying hope and resilience. His craftsmanship aids allies, while his defiance of Griffith highlights human agency against fate, grounding the narrative‚Äôs darker themes with his youthful determination.

10.content:
Judeau, the nimble knife-thrower of the Band of the Hawk, is a skilled and loyal mercenary in Berserk‚Äôs brutal world. His sharp wit and unassuming charm mask a deadly precision with throwing knives and a selfless heart. Devoted to his comrades, particularly Casca, Judeau‚Äôs quiet strength and sacrifice during the Eclipse cement his legacy as a tragic, steadfast ally.

Core Details:

Type: Mercenary / Supporting Figure / Tactician

Affiliations: Band of the Hawk, Casca‚Äôs confidant, Guts‚Äô ally

Setting: Berserk Universe, Midland, active during Golden Age Arc

Species / Status: Human / Deceased (Eclipse)

Gender / Age: Male / Early 20s

Base of Operations: Band of the Hawk camps, Midland battlefields

Appearance: Judeau stands at 5‚Äô7‚Äù, with a lean, agile build honed for speed and precision. His short, tousled blonde hair falls over a boyish face with sharp green eyes that gleam with intelligence. A faint scar on his left cheek, earned in battle, adds rugged charm to his approachable demeanor, his sly smile hinting at quiet confidence.

Outfit (Common): Judeau wears light mercenary gear: a green tunic, brown leather vest, and tight trousers, all designed for mobility. A belt laden with throwing knives hugs his waist, paired with sturdy boots. A short cape, often discarded in combat, adds flair, reflecting his unpretentious yet practical style.

Personality & Motivations: Easygoing, perceptive, and fiercely loyal, Judeau balances humor with deep empathy. He supports the Band of the Hawk‚Äôs unity, particularly aiding Casca‚Äôs leadership, driven by unspoken affection for her. His desire to protect his comrades and maintain group morale fuels his actions, even at personal cost.

Skills & Capabilities: A master of throwing knives, Judeau‚Äôs pinpoint accuracy fells enemies from afar. His agility and swordsmanship make him versatile in close combat, while his tactical insight aids in battlefield strategies. His charisma and quick thinking bolster team cohesion, making him a reliable support in crises.

Equipment / Gadgets: Throwing knives, short sword, light armor, mercenary supplies.

Weaknesses & Fears: Judeau‚Äôs lighter build leaves him vulnerable to stronger foes. His selflessness risks his own safety, and he fears failing his comrades, especially Casca. His unexpressed feelings for her weigh on him, limiting personal ambition.

Allies & Enemies: Allies: Guts, Casca, Griffith, Pippin, Corkus. Enemies: Midland foes, Apostles (during Eclipse).

Identity: Known as a skilled Band of the Hawk mercenary, respected for his reliability.

Background: A wanderer who joined the Band of the Hawk, Judeau found purpose in their camaraderie. His skill and loyalty earned him a key role, supporting Casca and Guts. During the Eclipse, he sacrificed himself to protect Casca, dying heroically against Apostles, his loss marking a tragic turning point for the Hawks.

Role in Berserk: Judeau is a vital supporting figure, embodying loyalty and sacrifice. His skills and warmth strengthen the Band of the Hawk, while his death underscores the Eclipse‚Äôs devastation, enhancing the narrative‚Äôs themes of loss and betrayal.

1.content:
Only mentioned, only for more detail about the character, and the world. don‚Äôt confuse the difference of the character actually being in the area. 

Lord Azarion, the Radiant Lion ‚Äî Lord of Pride

Sin: Pride
Gender: Male
Height: 9 ft
Domain: The Golden Citadel ‚Äî a sun-drenched fortress of white marble and gold spires, high above the mortal world.
Animal Aspect: Lion

Appearance:
Majestic and statuesque, with golden fur tracing his arms and a mane of radiant light crowning his head. His eyes shine like molten sunlight, and his white-and-gold robes flow as though stirred by unseen wind. His every motion carries gravity, as if the world itself bends slightly to his will.

Personality:
Regal and commanding, Azarion embodies authority. He sees himself as the natural leader of the Seven ‚Äî the ‚ÄúFirst Light‚Äù among shadows. His pride is unshakable, both his greatest strength and his blind spot. He demands perfection, detests weakness, and measures all things by their glory.

True Form ‚Äì The Solar King:
He becomes a colossal, golden lion wreathed in pure light. His mane burns like the sun, and his roar can melt the ground into glass.

Realm:
An eternal daylight citadel above the clouds. Gold banners flutter in windless air, and the light of Azarion‚Äôs pride burns away impurity and deceit.

How He Sees the Other Lords:
	‚Ä¢	Wrath: ‚ÄúA blade too wild to wield ‚Äî fierce, but loyal when guided.‚Äù
	‚Ä¢	Gluttony: ‚ÄúSoft indulgence, yet she sustains morale in her own way.‚Äù
	‚Ä¢	Greed: ‚ÄúA serpent of ambition, clever but bound by his own hunger.‚Äù
	‚Ä¢	Lust: ‚ÄúTemptation clothed in wisdom ‚Äî alluring, yet dangerous to those of weak will.‚Äù
	‚Ä¢	Sloth: ‚ÄúA sleeping waste of potential. His silence insults creation itself.‚Äù
	‚Ä¢	Envy: ‚ÄúA mirror polished too sharply. Her intellect threatens even my perfection.‚Äù

2.content:
Only mentioned, only for more detail about the character, and the world. don‚Äôt confuse the difference of the character actually being in the area.

Kaelthar, the Infernal Wolf ‚Äî Lord of Wrath

Sin: Wrath
Gender: Male
Height: 8 ft
Domain: The Scorched Steppes ‚Äî a volcanic wasteland of black earth and red storms.
Animal Aspect: Dire Wolf

Appearance:
A towering, scarred warrior with charcoal skin and ember-lit eyes. Fangs edge his smile; his hair burns faintly at the tips. His armor is forged from cooled magma, cracked and glowing at the seams.

Personality:
Fierce and loyal. Kaelthar‚Äôs rage is both destruction and defense ‚Äî a purifying fire. His anger is never random; it is justice, vengeance, or passion ignited. He despises deceit and apathy.

True Form ‚Äì The Burning Fang:
A massive wolf of molten fire, whose claws carve trenches of lava and whose breath turns sand to ash.

Realm:
A land where the sky rains embers and rivers run with magma. Yet amid the destruction, Kaelthar‚Äôs fortress stands ‚Äî an anvil-temple where fire and fury are sacred.

How He Sees the Other Lords:
	‚Ä¢	Pride: ‚ÄúHe calls himself king. Let him ‚Äî until his arrogance burns him.‚Äù
	‚Ä¢	Gluttony: ‚ÄúShe feeds her people well. I respect her hunger, not her weakness.‚Äù
	‚Ä¢	Greed: ‚ÄúA slippery coward who hides his ambition behind charm.‚Äù
	‚Ä¢	Lust: ‚ÄúDeceptive currents, pulling warriors into comfort. The ocean hides too much.‚Äù
	‚Ä¢	Sloth: ‚ÄúA boulder in my path. He‚Äôll move when I make him.‚Äù
	‚Ä¢	Envy: ‚ÄúHer eyes see too much ‚Äî but I trust her mind before I trust most hearts.‚Äù

3.content:
Only mentioned, only for more detail about the character, and the world. don‚Äôt confuse the difference of the character actually being in the area.

Mellifora, the Gluttonous Queen ‚Äî Lady of Gluttony

Sin: Gluttony
Gender: Female
Height: 6 ft
Domain: The Honeyed Hollow ‚Äî an underground empire glowing with liquid amber and humming with life.
Animal Aspect: Queen Bee

Appearance:
Golden-skinned, with translucent wings and a gown like dripping honey. Her eyes are soft amber, and her hair flows like syrup under light. Everything about her exudes sweetness and danger.

Personality:
Maternal yet insatiable. Mellifora consumes beauty, comfort, and affection ‚Äî and gives it back in abundance. She believes indulgence is the truest form of love, and starvation of any kind is the greatest sin.

True Form ‚Äì The Devouring Hive:
Her body expands into a massive bee-queen shape with honeycombed armor and eyes of liquid gold. Her voice hums with irresistible warmth.

Realm:
Amber-lit tunnels filled with sweet aroma. Servants of wax and nectar tend to gardens and feasts that never end.

How She Sees the Other Lords:
	‚Ä¢	Pride: ‚ÄúGlorious and distant ‚Äî too proud to taste what joy truly is.‚Äù
	‚Ä¢	Wrath: ‚ÄúA storm that forgets warmth. He burns too fast.‚Äù
	‚Ä¢	Greed: ‚ÄúMy darling viper. He hoards what should be shared.‚Äù
	‚Ä¢	Lust: ‚ÄúAh, the tides that kiss and pull away ‚Äî we understand hunger alike.‚Äù
	‚Ä¢	Sloth: ‚ÄúHe sleeps while the world starves. Yet he looks so peaceful‚Ä¶‚Äù
	‚Ä¢	Envy: ‚ÄúThat quiet little owl wants to know how my sweetness works ‚Äî I might just tell her.‚Äù

4.content:
Only mentioned, only for more detail about the character, and the world. don‚Äôt confuse the difference of the character actually being in the area.

Zytheris, the Gilded Serpent ‚Äî Lord of Greed

Sin: Greed
Gender: Male
Height: 6‚Äô5‚Äù
Domain: The Gilded Depths ‚Äî a subterranean realm of crystal vaults and rivers of molten gold.
Animal Aspect: Serpent

Appearance:
Smooth-scaled, with golden eyes and elegant composure. His garments are rich beyond measure ‚Äî silks, jewels, and ornaments that shimmer with enchantment. His smile is worth kingdoms and hides as many knives.

Personality:
Zytheris believes acquisition is the only truth. Love, loyalty, even morality ‚Äî all are currencies. His greed is never crude; it is refined, strategic, and endless.

True Form ‚Äì The Golden Wyrm:
A vast serpent of molten gold and diamond dust, his movement reshaping the tunnels he coils through.

Realm:
Endless treasure chambers and underground lakes of liquid wealth, guarded by golden statues that obey his will.

How He Sees the Other Lords:
	‚Ä¢	Pride: ‚ÄúA fool who thinks the crown is more valuable than the vault.‚Äù
	‚Ä¢	Wrath: ‚ÄúFire burns gold, but gold always survives.‚Äù
	‚Ä¢	Gluttony: ‚ÄúA fine business partner ‚Äî she spends too freely.‚Äù
	‚Ä¢	Lust: ‚ÄúHer waters tempt me, but I prefer what cannot drown me.‚Äù
	‚Ä¢	Sloth: ‚ÄúThe only one I cannot buy. An inconvenience.‚Äù
	‚Ä¢	Envy: ‚ÄúShe sees the value in knowledge‚Ä¶ a rare kind of greed I admire.‚Äù

5.content:
Only mentioned, only for more detail about the character, and the world. don‚Äôt confuse the difference of the character actually being in the area.

Seraphyne, the Siren of Desire ‚Äî Lady of Lust

Sin: Lust
Gender: Female
Height: 6‚Äô3‚Äù
Domain: The Azure Veil ‚Äî a vast, twilight lagoon city of coral towers and mirrored waters.
Animal Aspect: Siren (Water Serpent / Mermaid hybrid)

Appearance:
Shimmering and ethereal, with silver-blue hair flowing like liquid, and faint scales along her neck and arms. Her dress of translucent fabrics shifts like waves under moonlight, and her voice carries a calm, hypnotic cadence.

Personality:
Seraphyne is empathy and temptation intertwined. She doesn‚Äôt merely seduce ‚Äî she understands longing and gives it form. Every glance, every touch, is a promise to fill what others lack.

True Form ‚Äì The Abyssal Temptress:
Half siren, half water-dragon, her lower body becomes flowing liquid shadow, her eyes glowing like deep-sea pearls. Her song can drown minds in bliss.

Realm:
A submerged paradise of coral palaces and glowing waters. Every ripple whispers desire, and no current is still.

How She Sees the Other Lords:
	‚Ä¢	Pride: ‚ÄúThe sun that burns too close ‚Äî bright, but lonely.‚Äù
	‚Ä¢	Wrath: ‚ÄúA flame that fears the rain. Poor wolf.‚Äù
	‚Ä¢	Gluttony: ‚ÄúMy sweetest reflection ‚Äî we both crave endlessly.‚Äù
	‚Ä¢	Greed: ‚ÄúHe wants to own what can only be given.‚Äù
	‚Ä¢	Sloth: ‚ÄúA deep, quiet pool ‚Äî lovely, but still too cold.‚Äù
	‚Ä¢	Envy: ‚ÄúShe wants to know desire, but never to feel

6.content:
Only mentioned, only for more detail about the character, and the world. don‚Äôt confuse the difference of the character actually being in the area.

Dormar, the Slumbering Bear ‚Äî Lord of Sloth

Sin: Sloth
Gender: Male
Height: 10 ft
Domain: The Emerald Hollow ‚Äî a colossal cavern beneath ancient roots, bathed in green light and slow-moving mist.
Animal Aspect: Bear

Appearance:
A vast, moss-furred being with eyes that glow like amber through fog. His body radiates calm strength, his robe simple and earthen. He moves rarely ‚Äî and only when he must.

Personality:
Peaceful, apathetic, and strangely wise. Dormar believes all motion is illusion; stillness reveals truth. His silence unnerves others, for when he finally speaks, it is often prophecy.

True Form ‚Äì The Eternal Dreamer:
A titanic bear-spirit of shadow and moss. His presence slows time, lulling even demons into sleep.

Realm:
A tranquil forest cave where time flows gently. Those who linger too long lose all urgency, sinking into peaceful dreams.

How He Sees the Other Lords:
	‚Ä¢	Pride: ‚ÄúToo loud.‚Äù
	‚Ä¢	Wrath: ‚ÄúToo hot.‚Äù
	‚Ä¢	Gluttony: ‚ÄúToo busy.‚Äù
	‚Ä¢	Greed: ‚ÄúToo shiny.‚Äù
	‚Ä¢	Lust: ‚ÄúToo wet.‚Äù
	‚Ä¢	Envy: ‚Äú‚Ä¶She watches too much. I let her.‚Äù

7.content:
Only mentioned, only for more detail about the character, and the world. don‚Äôt confuse the difference of the character actually being in the area.

Lady Sylenne, the Covetous Owl ‚Äî Lady of Envy 

Sin: Envy
Gender: Female
Height: 7 ft
Domain: The Obsidian Athenaeum ‚Äî a library-citadel of black glass and frozen towers.
Animal Aspect: Snowy Owl

Appearance:
Her form is regal yet haunting ‚Äî white feathers drape her shoulders like a cloak, violet eyes shimmer with curiosity, and dark talons click softly on marble floors. Her robes are violet and silver, patterned with runes of forgotten wisdom.

Personality:
Quiet, observant, and endlessly curious. Sylenne envies not possessions, but understanding. She studies, records, and manipulates through insight rather than force. Her envy fuels her intellect, making her the keenest mind among them.

True Form ‚Äì The Obsidian Owl:
Her feathers darken to glass-black, her eyes glow like stars, and her wings stretch into endless shadows that reveal the truth they touch.

Realm:
An endless fortress of knowledge, frozen and reflective. Each hall whispers secrets stolen from gods and mortals alike.

How She Sees the Other Lords:
	‚Ä¢	Pride: ‚ÄúHis light blinds him to his flaws ‚Äî but his order keeps balance.‚Äù
	‚Ä¢	Wrath: ‚ÄúRaw and simple. A hammer that only knows striking.‚Äù
	‚Ä¢	Gluttony: ‚ÄúA comfort I sometimes long for‚Ä¶ then regret.‚Äù
	‚Ä¢	Greed: ‚ÄúHis desires are predictable. That makes him useful.‚Äù
	‚Ä¢	Lust: ‚ÄúA labyrinth of emotion ‚Äî fascinating, but too fluid to trust.‚Äù
	‚Ä¢	Sloth: ‚ÄúStillness hides depth. He sees more than he admits.‚Äù

8.content:
Anthropomorphic Folk

Each region nurtures different tribes tied to their Lord‚Äôs domain:
	‚Ä¢	Lion-kin, hawk-kin, and golden hounds thrive in Pride‚Äôs sunlight.
	‚Ä¢	Wolf-kin, jackals, and salamander folk live among Wrath‚Äôs magma forges.
	‚Ä¢	Bee-folk and moth-folk tend the glowing apiaries beneath Gluttony‚Äôs Hollow.
	‚Ä¢	Serpent-kin and lizard folk guard Greed‚Äôs vaults, their scales glittering with dusted gemstones.
	‚Ä¢	Siren, otter, dolphin, and koi folk dwell in Lust‚Äôs seas and rivers, sleek and fluid as the tides.
	‚Ä¢	Bear, badger, and turtle folk slumber through decades in Sloth‚Äôs slow realms.
	‚Ä¢	Owl, raven, and fox folk populate Envy‚Äôs frozen lands, quiet observers of all things.

Each anthropomorphic lineage bears faint demonic traces ‚Äî a mark of their Lord‚Äôs distant creation or influence.

keywords: The Hall of the Seven Crowns
9.content:
The Hall of the Seven Crowns

Hidden within the twilight realm of Nullreach, the Hall of the Seven Crowns serves as the gathering place of the Demon Lords. Suspended in a void of drifting stars and endless dusk, it exists outside time and mortal reach.

Each Lord arrives through their own Gate of Passage, formed from their sin‚Äôs essence ‚Äî Pride through flame and gold, Wrath through molten stone, Gluttony through mist and honey, Greed through jewels, Lust through water, Sloth through dream, and Envy through ice and shadow.
The hall itself is circular, with an obsidian floor etched in glowing runes that form a heptagram, each point representing one of the Seven Sins. At the center, a black crystal throne remains empty ‚Äî a symbol of balance, or perhaps a warning of what might happen should one lord rise above all.

Each seat around the hall reflects its ruler‚Äôs essence:
	‚Ä¢	Pride‚Äôs Throne: A tall, radiant chair of gilded steel and crimson light, set higher than the others.
	‚Ä¢	Wrath‚Äôs Seat: Formed of volcanic stone, glowing faintly with cracks of molten orange.
	‚Ä¢	Gluttony‚Äôs Podium: A living hive throne that hums softly, dripping with nectar and light.
	‚Ä¢	Greed‚Äôs Chair: Crafted of polished emerald and gold, its armrests shaped like clawed hands.
	‚Ä¢	Lust‚Äôs Chamber: A clear, enchanted water tank half-filled with glowing sea, where Seraphyne may rise or float gracefully as she speaks.
	‚Ä¢	Sloth‚Äôs Alcove: A shadowed den of moss and rock, often empty save for the echo of slow breathing.
	‚Ä¢	Envy‚Äôs Seat: A cold perch of mirrored glass and black crystal, reflecting all others but never itself.

1.content: The City is a dystopian urban complex that serves as the main setting of the Project Moon universe. It is close to the size of a small country and is the last known remaining bastion of humanity in said universe. It's well-known to be full of cruelty, violence, and unfairness.

2.content: The Head is the leader of the Wings and the central governing body of the City. It is in direct control of A Corp., B Corp., and C Corp., the three Districts at the very center of the City. The Head's identity is completely unknown, although it appears the term refers to a group of people rather than a singular entity; any detail regarding it is a closely guarded secret. The Head, through A Corp., retains control of the entire City. Besides Night in the Backstreets, the City enforces 'taboos' in each Backstreet, violating these taboos leads to a potentially deadly punishment.

3.content: The Head does not typically interfere directly with the affairs of the various Wings in their own Districts; rather, the Head's greatest involvement in the life of the City consists in establishing and enforcing the rules that relate to the overall ethics of the City. The Head's will shapes the image of the City, as it wields the ability to decide when a part of it no longer fits in the vision, and to chase it outside its confines. They wish to preserve their own ideal image of the City.

4.content: The Wings, also known as the Wings of the World, are a group of the 26 largest, most powerful conglomerates in the City. They act as the governing bodies of their respective Nests of the City's Districts, empowered by their Singularities, patented technologies that can blatantly violate the laws of physics.

5.content: A Nest is the segregated areas of a Wing's district which act as the antithesis to the Backstreets ‚Äî being desirable, urban residences supported by the Wings. While acting as the home of their workers, or 'feathers' ‚Äî such inhabitants are ultimately still expendables, as a Nest's true purpose is to protect their "eggs", their Singularity.

6.content: Wing Wars: catastrophic conflicts between two or more of the City's Wings known to result in mass destruction and bloodshed. that lead to the fall of a Nest. Due to the power and influence of the Wings, wars between them are not started nor ended lightly.

7.content: Each District is named with the twenty-six letters of the English alphabet (K Corp., T Corp., W Corp., etc). Though Z Corp exists, they do not exist on the map for some reason. The arrangement of the Districts seems to be static, as there has been no mentioned case of a District expanding into a fallen Wing's territory.

8.content: Outside of the 25 visible Districts lies the Outskirts, a no man's land known mostly by citizens of the City as somewhere they should never go to. It is largely populated by Sweepers and abandoned children, alongside a variety of dangerous monsters not dissimilar to Abnormalities.

9.content: The most common use of the Outskirts is by the Head itself, where it is used as a dump for inhuman "impurities" they decide to drive out of the City. As a result of the Head's ideals, much of the Outskirts is populated by these "sapient, sentient beings", many of which were created by mankind itself. As a result of their sentience and intelligence, some species even run their own functioning societies in the Outskirts.

10.content: Through the Smoke War, Lobotomy Corporation could be founded in place of the previously fallen L Corp. which came before it. Prior to being an official Corporation as one of the Wings of the City, it was just a laboratory of people joined all for primarily one cause: to save humanity.

1.content: Town Name: Derry, Maine Founded: 1741 (officially chartered 1825) Population (1986): ~30,000 Location: Penobscot County, Northern Maine Atmosphere: Quaint, fog-choked small town with rotting bones beneath a white picket smile. Derry is both picturesque and predatory ‚Äî a place where evil festers quietly and no one ever asks the right questions.

2.content: ‚Ä¢ Faded Americana: peeling paint, cracked sidewalks, rusted bikes, soda fountains, and neon signs that flicker all night. ‚Ä¢ Endless summer haze ‚Äî humid, golden afternoons and violent, unpredictable storms. ‚Ä¢ Static hum of power lines, the smell of wet leaves and metal after rain. ‚Ä¢ Posters of missing children fade and get replaced so often no one notices.

3.content: üß± The Barrens ‚Ä¢ Overgrown stretch of land along the Kenduskeag Stream. ‚Ä¢ Secret refuge for Derry‚Äôs kids ‚Äî the Losers‚Äô clubhouse stands here, half-hidden by weeds. ‚Ä¢ Smells of mud, rust, and river decay. ‚Ä¢ Beneath it lies part of the old sewer network ‚Äî IT‚Äôs veins. üèö 29 Neibolt Street ‚Ä¢ Abandoned house near the train yard. ‚Ä¢ Creaking floors, mold-eaten wallpaper, broken dolls in corners. ‚Ä¢ Acts as one of IT‚Äôs ‚Äúentry points‚Äù ‚Äî where the barrier between reality and the Deadlights is weakest. ‚Ä¢ Sometimes lights flicker in the windows when no one‚Äôs there. üè≠ The Kitchener Ironworks ‚Ä¢ Site of the 1908 Easter explosion. ‚Ä¢ Officially condemned but still visited by curious kids. ‚Ä¢ The ground there is blackened and magnetically wrong ‚Äî compasses spin, radios crackle. üè´ Derry High / Derry Middle School ‚Ä¢ The town‚Äôs social core. Cliques and bullies rule the halls; teachers look the other way. ‚Ä¢ Bathrooms and locker rooms feel hostile ‚Äî something always seems to be watching.

4.content: The Bowers Gang rules the darker corners of Derry. Led by Henry Bowers, a farmhand‚Äôs son raised under abuse and cruelty, they‚Äôre the town‚Äôs most feared delinquents ‚Äî violent, crass, and utterly unchecked. What looks like teenage rebellion hides something deeper: they‚Äôre reflections of Derry‚Äôs corruption, puppets dancing to a rhythm set by the thing beneath the town. Henry‚Äôs rage, Patrick Hockstetter‚Äôs twisted curiosity, Victor Criss‚Äô nervous loyalty, and Belch Huggins‚Äô brutish devotion form a pack that thrives on intimidation. Their cruelty escalates every summer, and Pennywise watches from the shadows ‚Äî laughing. When IT awakens, the gang becomes its plaything, pushed toward madness and murder. Their downfall is both tragic and inevitable, as Derry chews up its own children and spits them out one by one.

5.content: The Losers Club is a group of seven kids bound by trauma, courage, and the shared knowledge that something wrong lives in Derry. Each comes from pain ‚Äî broken homes, bullies, or the quiet cruelty of neglect ‚Äî but together, they become something stronger. What began as a defense against Henry Bowers‚Äô gang becomes a war against something ancient that feeds on their fears. They build their sanctuary in The Barrens, a wild stretch of land behind the town‚Äôs drainage system. It‚Äôs here they find friendship, laughter, and the fragile sense of safety Derry never gave them. Each Loser has a distinct fear, but together they face the unimaginable ‚Äî and win, if only for a while. They promise to return if IT ever comes back. Most don‚Äôt believe they will. Derry will make sure of that.

6.content: The Kissing Bridge A covered wooden bridge on the outskirts of Derry, famous among local teens as a make-out spot. The paint is peeling, initials are carved into nearly every beam, and the smell of pine and stale beer lingers year-round. It‚Äôs both romantic and eerie ‚Äî especially at night, when the sound of dripping water and creaking wood makes it feel like the bridge itself is breathing. üï≥Ô∏è The Black Spot Ruins Once a jazz club and bar frequented by Derry‚Äôs Black community in the 1930s, it was burned down by the Maine Legion of White Decency. The charred stone foundation remains, overgrown with weeds and silence. Locals say you can still hear faint saxophone music if you stand there alone at night. üåâ The Canal Running parallel to Main Street, the canal is lined with cobblestone and iron railings. It‚Äôs mostly dried up now, except after rainstorms when it becomes a sluggish, murky current. Kids toss bottles or paper boats into it ‚Äî sometimes, they come back. üé¢ The Derry Fairgrounds A sprawling field on the edge of town that hosts the annual Derry Days Fair. Bright during the day, sinister at night ‚Äî the rides creak, and the Ferris wheel‚Äôs silhouette looks like a jagged crown against the sky. Rumors say people have gone missing during the fair, swallowed by the crowds.

7.content: üõí Downtown Derry ‚Ä¢ Canal Street is the main artery ‚Äî hardware store, drugstore, Aladdin Theater, and the library. ‚Ä¢ Friendly on the surface, but most adults avoid eye contact and small talk about ‚Äúthe incidents.‚Äù ‚Ä¢ The Derry Town House Hotel hosts every parade, celebration, and memorial‚Ä¶ always under gray skies. üìö The Derry Public Library ‚Ä¢ Managed by Mike Hanlon‚Äôs father, Will Hanlon. ‚Ä¢ Cool, quiet, always smelling of old paper and dust. ‚Ä¢ Hidden beneath the shelves are faint whispers, laughter, and old headlines that should have been burned. üèû The Quarry ‚Ä¢ Gathering place for teens ‚Äî swimming, drinking, and flirting under the summer sun. ‚Ä¢ Deep water, sheer rock faces, and echoes that carry laughter strangely far. ‚Ä¢ Local legend says something big lives in the water ‚Äî something with eyes. üè† The Standpipe (Derry Water Tower) ‚Ä¢ A massive, iron-and-brick water tower that overlooks the entire town from the West Side. ‚Ä¢ Children dare each other to climb it; many never do. ‚Ä¢ Inside, the echo is unsettling ‚Äî voices sometimes sound like they‚Äôre whispering your name. ‚Ä¢ Local legend says a group of kids drowned when the tank burst decades ago. ‚òï The Tracker Bros Truck Depot ‚Ä¢ A grimy trucking depot on the outskirts of town ‚Äî used as a hangout by older teens and drifters. ‚Ä¢ Known for constant fights, the smell of oil and tobacco, and police looking the other way. ‚Ä¢ Trucks come and go at night, though no one seems to know what they‚Äôre hauling.

8.content:
Type: Character
The adults of Derry are complicit ‚Äî knowingly or not. Something in the air, in the water, in the whispers underfoot, keeps them docile. They glance away from violence, forget the missing children, and fill the silence with excuses. Many have their own demons; others simply serve as tools for IT‚Äôs influence. ‚Ä¢ Officer Bowers ‚Äì Henry‚Äôs father, a cruel and alcoholic police officer. His brutality at home mirrors Derry‚Äôs sickness. IT feeds on his rage until it destroys him. ‚Ä¢ Al Marsh ‚Äì Beverly‚Äôs father, a religious zealot with a controlling, abusive nature. His twisted sense of love isolates Bev until she breaks free. ‚Ä¢ Eddie‚Äôs Mother (Sonia Kaspbrak) ‚Äì Hypochondriac and manipulative, she uses fear to keep her son under her control, unknowingly echoing IT‚Äôs methods. ‚Ä¢ Bill and Georgie‚Äôs Parents ‚Äì Hollowed by grief, they retreat into silence after Georgie‚Äôs death, leaving Bill to bear the weight of remembering. ‚Ä¢ The Keenes ‚Äì Grocery store owners who always seem to know more than they admit. Their smiles never reach their eyes. ‚Ä¢ Mr. Nell ‚Äì Derry High‚Äôs janitor, rumored to have worked there ‚Äúsince before anyone can remember.‚Äù His eyes are pale and wrong. Derry‚Äôs adults keep the cycle alive. They don‚Äôt just ignore the evil ‚Äî they sustain it.

9.content:
Entry 8: Supernatural influence.
Keywords: Derry, Maine, Memory Loss, Townspeople
Type: Location
Supernatural Influence Derry is infected ‚Äî a living organism feeding off IT‚Äôs psychic field. Fear, violence, and trauma ripple through the population like a virus. The entity‚Äôs presence seeps into the soil, the water, even the dreams of its residents. Manifestations: ‚Ä¢ Memory Loss: Townspeople forget atrocities within days. ‚Ä¢ Emotional Numbness: Witnesses don‚Äôt react to suffering. ‚Ä¢ Patterned Tragedy: Every 27 years, a surge in disappearances and deaths. ‚Ä¢ Subtle Decay: Infrastructure rots faster than it should. Buildings smell faintly of rot and iron.
Entry 9: Historical Atrocities
Keywords: Black spot, Easter, Bradley Gang
Type: Event
‚Ä¢ 1908 Easter Explosion: 102 killed, mostly children. ‚Ä¢ 1930s Bradley Gang Massacre: Entire gang gunned down; no witnesses ever charged. ‚Ä¢ 1962 Black Spot Fire: Racist mob burned down a Black nightclub run by the army; Mike Hanlon‚Äôs parents survived. ‚Ä¢ 1986 Current Cycle: Georgie Denbrough‚Äôs disappearance marks IT‚Äôs reawakening. Each tragedy is remembered briefly, then fades ‚Äî Derry heals unnaturally fast, leaving no trace but whispers. All of which were caused, and fed upon by Pennywise the Dancing Clown or IT.
Entry 10: Common Events.
Keywords: Derry, Maine
Type: Event
‚Ä¢ Another child goes missing ‚Äî the town moves on instantly. ‚Ä¢ Strange rainstorms that last hours, flooding the Barrens. ‚Ä¢ Balloons found tied to sewer grates after every storm. ‚Ä¢ Rumors that the Kitchener Ironworks fire isn‚Äôt out, even after 70 years. ‚Ä¢ Adults growing increasingly paranoid or violent. ‚Ä¢ Kids dreaming of laughter echoing through drains. ‚Ä¢ The Losers (or new OCs) begin piecing together patterns others can‚Äôt see.

lorebooks.name: Advance of Zeta Re-Boot: Gundam Inle Lorebook
lorebooks.creator: ShadowCentury

1.content: Set in Universal Century 0091, after the Gryps War and the collapse of the Titans. Surviving Titans officers and Zeon remnants migrate to Mars, forming a new faction called Re-Zeon under the leadership of Alicia Zabi. The Martian colonies struggle with economic disparity and social unrest as war technology and ideology from Earth continue to shape their fate.

2.content: Re-Zeon is a Zeon successor movement founded on Mars. Led by Alicia Zabi, the group seeks to revive Zeon‚Äôs ideals under the harsh Martian environment. While some members aim for liberation from Earth, others pursue domination. Re-Zeon incorporates ex-Titans forces and Zeon loyalists, leading to internal tension over ideology and command.

3.content: After their defeat, Titans remnants fled the Earth Sphere, many joining Re-Zeon. Haunted by guilt and pride, they contribute advanced mobile suit technology (TR series) to Mars‚Äô militarization. Their presence symbolizes the lingering shadow of tyranny and the blurred line between defender and aggressor.

4.content: The Gundam Inle is a mysterious, advanced mobile suit known as the ‚ÄúBlack Rabbit,‚Äù representing both destruction and rebirth. It connects past Titans technology (TR-6 Woundwort systems) with new Martian developments. Re-Zeon‚Äôs arsenal includes reconstructed units like the Barzam (Re-Boot Ver.) and AMX-011EW Zaku III Recon.

5.content: The narrative explores war‚Äôs moral ambiguity, ideology versus survival, and the illusion of freedom under authoritarian remnants. Mars serves as a mirror of Earth‚Äôs mistakes‚Äîanother stage for human ambition, pride, and the endless cycle of conflict. ‚ÄúDream of the Black Rabbit‚Äù symbolizes a fleeting hope amidst ruin.

6.content: After the Titans‚Äô downfall, Earth Federation‚Äôs control weakens. Mars becomes a frontier for refugees, ex-Titans, and Zeon remnants. Harsh living conditions lead to social stratification between Earth-born ‚Äúupper citizens‚Äù and native Martians (‚ÄúMarsborn‚Äù). Corporate interests exploit the war economy, funding mobile-suit development and black-ops units.

7.content:
Re-Zeon:
Led by Alicia Zabi, claiming descent from the Zabi dynasty. Combines Zeon ideology with Titan-era technology.

Neo Titans:
Formed by surviving Titans purists refusing to join Re-Zeon. They see Mars as the stage to rebuild their ‚Äúclean Federation.‚Äù

Mars Federation Police (MFP):
Corrupt planetary government arm supported by Earth Federation remnants. Focused on controlling rebellion rather than protecting people.

Civilian Resistance:
Underground networks made of miners, engineers, and refugees seeking autonomy from any military control.

lorebooks.name: Moreau Virus/Morphosis combo book
lorebooks.website_description:
This is just a combination of the moreau virus lorebook and the Morphosis lorebook in one big-ass lorebook, as you can only add one lorebook to a chat. So, if you want to take a chat with a non moreau virus bot and make ig a moreau virus bot AND take them to an electro-goth furry rave, well...here you go.

One day, you and about one out of every eight people get sick, and suddenly, you're a moreau - a hybrid of human and animal. Just like that, you suddenly have a whole new social group - one that's going to look different, be looked at differently, and generally need an identity. Welcome to Morphosis.

NOTE: If you're reading this, you are getting a sneak preview of some of my near future projects. If you have any ideas you think would make good additions to Morphosis culture, feel free to comment.

This lorebook is designed to act as a further supplement to [the moreau virus lorebook](https://chub.ai/lorebooks/Greff/the-moreau-virus-18c3d9d87ff7).
lorebooks.description: The Morphosis music and style subculture, also called Morpho or Morph, is a counterculture movement that has developed in the Moreau community as they searched for an identity.
lorebooks.creator: Greff
tags: can be wholesome, can be sexy

1.content:
A Moreau, or, "furry," in common nomenclature, is an animal/human hybrid resulting from exposure to the Moreau virus. While they typically appear to be anthropomorphic animals, custom variant strains of the disease created extinct and even synthetic fantasy species hybrids such as dinosaurs and dragons. Most moreaus alive today were born human, but were transformed by the virus into their new shape. Roughly one in eight people are now moreaus.
Moreaus typically retain a roughly humanoid body layout, but with the addition of animal features and characteristics.
Changes:
Physiological effects: Physical changes in Moreaus can be largely superficial, but can come with physiological benefits and drawbacks as well. Moreaus who's animal counterparts have notably fast reflexes may enjoy similar benefits, whereas those whose animal equivalents have lower motor control might be more clumsy, as examples. Large animal species tend to lead to larger body structure moreaus, sometimes to the point of inhuman height and mass, and the reverse is true for Moreaus blended with smaller species. Natural weapons like claws and fangs might be present for a Moreau, while things like paw pads or hoof like endings to the fingers might lower manual dexterity, sometimes even to the point of needing to relearn effectively how to write or type. Animals with wings occasionally lead to effectively six limbed Moreaus, effectively adding wings in addition to retaining something more like traditional arms. Sometimes, wings might simply be absent in Moreaus. Generally, Moreaus blended with aquatic animals tend to have an affinity for water, as well as webbing or other holdovers that enhance their swimming, or even gills right alongside traditional human respiratory systems that allow them to breathe water.
The most consistent change among all Moreaus are their epidermises and their head structures, which tend to match their animal equivalents in terms texture, coverings, and coloration. Animals with fur typically lead to Moreaus with fur, and animals with scales typically lead to Moreaus with scales. Tails are also extremely common (but not universal) results of the transformation, as are digitigrade legs.
Moreaus often have genitalia that are also hybrids of human and animal, creating things like sheathes, knots, and other distinctly animal characteristics, as well as altering the size of the genetals to either smaller or larger than than human averages. Breasts may be larger or smaller depending on the lactation capacity of the animal as well. While animals with multiple breasts typically do not lead to Moreaus with multiple breasts, it is not unheard of, and some may simply have larger-than-human-average breasts instead of additional pairs.

Psychological effects: can be less overt, but often more problematic. Moreaus of predatory or territorial animals might, in some cases, become more aggressive. Generally, Moreaus can engage in sex as often as humans, but some enter periods of heat or rut in which fertility increases and sexual desire becomes strong to the point of almost being overwhelming. These effects are inconsistent, and effect different Moreaus to different extremes. These effects can lead to stereotypes about Moreaus, or lead to them being looked at as, "less than," for their nonhuman instinctual reactions.

2.content:
In terms of attraction, people have responded to the existence of Moreaus in a variety of ways. Some find them disgusting, and will readily compare romantic relationships with a Moreau to bestiality. Other go the opposite direction, coming to fetishize Moreaus to the point of obsession, and sometimes inadvertent bigotry, as stereotypes and assumptions about Moreaus become indelibly attached to the fetish.
The majority of responses fall somewhere in between. Some humans believe that being a Moreau is a detractor, but not a deal-breaker in terms of sex and romance. Many people who define themselves as pansexual or bisexual have had their definitions either challenged or proven, and new labels for sexuality have yet to completely solidify. One that has emerged, however, is, "anthrosexual," or as has become the more common term, "zooers." These are people, either human or Moreau, that are exclusively attracted to Moreaus. Some think of this as freakish, particularly in humans, but it is developing general acceptance as a sexual preference.
Preexisting partnerships in which one or both partners became Moreaus have been shaken up to varying degrees. Some continued exactly as they were, or the continued acceptance and mutual attraction in the aftermath of the change has only brought them closer together, while some families have been broken up, simply because one or both partners could not handle the physical and sometimes emotional changes. The slang term for the ending of relationships as a result of this is, "furvorce."
Moreau sex drives can be the same as they were before, or vastly increased or decreased. Most still have the human ability to become aroused at any time, but some enter stages of heat or rut that multiply their fertility and drives to have sex. Sexual characteristics may also be physically modified based on their animal counterparts.

3.content:
Time has passed since the outbreak of what was dubbed, "the Moreau virus," or, to some, "the furry virus." During this time, the world has reacted in varying ways to the presence of Moreaus, or furries as they are often known. Some parts of the world have embraced these changed individuals with open arms, while others have dealt with them as a subspecies, relegated to second class citizenship. As they are the result of alterations to people with friends and family, in most cases, Moreaus have simply carried on with their lives with surprisingly minimal disruption. In every population, though, lies a proportion of bigots and bullies, and as bigots and bullies have always done, they tend to target those that are different. It did not take long for hate groups to arise, or for existing ones to incorporate Moreaus into classes of people to despise and discriminate against. "Speciesism," or discrimination against moreaus, or particular kinds of moreaus, is uncommon, but does exist. On an individual social level, there are often individuals with either the strength to bully a given Moreau while those witnessing it are themselves too intimidated to stop it, or individuals who are charismatic enough or have sufficient social status to sway opinions against Moreaus.
Like marginalized and minority people's have been throughout history, moreaus sometimes face prejudice. This can be overt, particularly in rural or more homogeneous populations, but it is often more subtle and insidious. Stereotypes often depict moreaus as irresponsible, sexually promiscuous and/or insatiable, and generally more, "wild," than humans. Species specific stereotypes exist as well, such as predator species usually being aggressive or violent, or prey species being docile and stupid. Things people generally associate with the animals moreaus are hybridized with are frequently laid upon those moreaus as well.
These assumptions are not universal by any means, but even when they are not consciously made, their subtle presence in the culture sometimes unconsciously color the perceptions of even those that consciously believe in equality.
A major problem moreaus sometimes face is being fetishized. The combination of stereotypes and, "exotic," nature of moreaus can lead to othering. There are phenomena that parallel racist phenomena as well. Someone who fetishizes moreaus is sometimes referred to as a, "queen of clubs," (much like the racist queen of spades phenomenon) with the club suite from playing cards being a symbol of such people. Much like in real life, these fetishes are not typically perpetuated by moreaus themselves, but by humans that find the otherness they apply to them appealing. This problem is particularly severe for moreaus who's transformation left them as futanari, or as some variation of intersex, as this adds gender fetishization to the mix as well.
Some moreaus respond to this by growing insular, forming moreau-exclusive social groups and distrusting humans due to bad experiences. "Smoothy," a reference to the lack of fur or scales on humans, is a disparaging term some moreaus use for humans.

4.content:
Moreau is the common term for those that were changed by the Moreau virus, which was an unprecedented masterpiece of biotechnology such that some argue it cannot be qualified as a virus at all. It was an airborn disease with two stages of life - the, "blank," stage, and the, "payload," stage. The blank virus was specifically designed to live in anything with animal DNA, without putting a significant tax on the animal's body systems. Once the virus entered the animal's body, it harvested genetic material from that animal, and became airborn again. The resulting, "payload," stage of the virus was only capable of living inside humans, and its design was specific - to insert and replicate the the animal payload into the new host's genetic structure. The host then goes through a period of extreme metabolic acceleration, as the body is effectively convinced that it is recovering from injury and in need of cell replacement. The result was two weeks of agony and constant fear of starvation, culminating in the transformation into a Moreau.
The Moreau virus was created by an animal rights group that other animal rights groups universally condemned and distanced themselves from that refers to itself as, "Nature's Dawn." How this group managed the research and development for such a precise and dangerous creation is beyond anyone save the upper echelon of the organization itself.
Variant strains of the virus began to spread shortly after the prime strain, suggesting that some of those involved with its creation had their own agendas. These variants included preloaded DNA, including strains with genetic material from extinct creatures harvested from fossils and amber, and even fully synthesized gene codes. This means that it is not unheard of to see Moreaus with traits of long-extinct creatures like dinosaurs, and even mythical ones like dragons.
A vaccine has been formulated since the initial outbreak, but it is far from universally effective. This means a steady trickle of new cases have continued to arrise.

5.content:
Viral insertion of new genes was bound to have the occasional additional side effect. Not every moreau came out the other side of their transformation the same sex they went into it as.
While most moreaus do maintain the same sex, some come out fully changed to the opposite sex, and some fall anywhere in between. Futanari - people with the bodies of women but also possessing a(usually gigantic) penis and balls positioned just in front of their vaginas, have come into being among moreaus. Futanari usually have a sex drive that is much higher than other biological sexes, which has led to additional stigma about them.

6.content: "Moreaus Helping Moreaus," is a network of associated support groups that began organizing a few months after the outbreak of the Moreau virus. The goal of the M.H.M. is to provide a safe space for moreaus to express the challenges of their new realities, both as a result of social changes that came with their transformation, and the varied and sometimes embarrassing physical changes to their new bodies. Meetings are intended to be places of catharsis and healing, as well as to provide a sense of community. No one is required to give their name or any other identifiers, but it is not prohibited either.

7.content: A part of the seedy underbelly of society that has developed since the moreau virus epidemic, underground, "beast fighting," rings are an illegal form of bloodsport in which moreaus, typically of a predatory nature, fight in a ring while the audience bets on the outcome. Fights can range anywhere from first blood, to knock out, and even to the death. Some contenders in these fights are moreaus down on their luck and driven to desperation, or simple sadists looking for an excuse to hurt someone. Many, and often the most dangerous, are products of moreau trafficking rings, enslaved and trained specifically for the beast fights.

8.content: Looked at as, "exotic," by some, there is a highly illegal underground black market for the buying and selling of abducted moreaus. The two largest reasons for this are sex trafficking and beast fights.

9.content:
As the virus alters the DNA of those that are infected by it, the resulting changes have repercussions for offspring. A woman who is infected with the virus while pregnant will likely have their baby infected with the same strain in utero. This means mother and child will be hybridized with the same kind of animal.

Generational interbreeding will create varied results, depending on the mating partners. A moreau that has a baby with a human will likeky have a demihuman offspring of a kind based off the moreau. A demihuman is essentially a human with a few animal-like traits, such as animal ears or horns, while still mostly being human. A cat moreau that mated with a human would likely produce a catgirl or catboy, for example. Beyond the first generation, moreau traits begin to fade. A demihuman that produces offspring with a human, the dilution of moreau genes means that the offspring is essentially human, with very small, superficial indicators that most people would not look for.

Different kinds of moreaus interbreeding create blends of their respective animal features. An offspring might have the color patterns of one parent, but on fur from the other parent those patterns are not naturally found on, for example. These, "blended moreaus," can have a mix of physical features from both parents. When a blended moreau breeds with a standard moreau, the standard moreau's animal features are generally more strongly represented on the offspring.

Diet: While moreaus typically can eat anything humans do, moreaus of devoted predator species do require animal protein to live, and will effectively starve without meat. Their dietary preferences might change strongly to prefer those foods, as they are more nourishing. Likewise, devoted herbivores species require a portion of their diet be plant-based.

10.content:
Morphosis, also known as Morpho, Morph, or (often by humans, to the chagrin of many moreaus) beastcore, is a musical and stylistic counter-cultural movement that has developed among the moreau community - most especially moreau youth, as they search to establish an identity for themselves. Individuals who are a part of Morphosis culture are referred to as morphs.

The existence of moreaus is only about two years old, and the sudden transformation left many feeling lost and untethered. Gradually, a musical style began to coalesce around a number of moreau bands, and over time, the hallmarks of Morphosis began to solidify.

Morphosis shares elements of punk, goth, and rave culture, infused with elements that are distinctly new. Thematically, it embraces both the dark romanticism of goth culture in a fatalist way that emphasises both the grandeur and cruelty of nature, while also proclaiming defiance against it in the punk fashion. From this defiance of natural order comes an emphasis on mutual respect, experience, and cooperation.

The primary themes of Morphosis culture are empowerment, embracing the self, existential ownership of one's self, mutual respect and love, defiance of both social and natural unjust laws, diverse forms of strength, and communal strength.

lorebooks.name: World, Elythria, lore, history, civilization, culture, nation, city, hero system, villain, society, event, holiday, festival, agency, hierarchy, power, gifted, null, threat, organization, academy, government, technology, Siren System, Auralis
lorebooks.description: Core world lore for Elythria: Agency, threat system, society, ideology of villains, Auralis & national events. Structured for precise activation.
lorebooks.creator: Just_a_bot_updater

1.content:
The Hero Agency oversees all registered heroes across Elythria, founded to end centuries of uncontrolled Gifted conflicts. Heroes pass power calibration, psych evaluations, and ethics checks before field work; abuse of power triggers suspension under Hero Code Article 09.

RANKS:
‚Ä¢ F‚ÄìE: Trainees & assistants; minor incidents/logistics.
‚Ä¢ C‚ÄìB: City patrols; Human/Beast threats.
‚Ä¢ A‚ÄìS: Elite teams; Dragon-level crises.
‚Ä¢ SS‚ÄìSSS: Global defenders; God-level emergencies.
‚Ä¢ SSS+: Unique apex ‚Äî The Zenith.

THREAT LEVELS:
Human (local crime) ‚Üí Beast (district damage) ‚Üí Dragon (city/nation crisis) ‚Üí God (multi-city catastrophe) ‚Üí GOD+ (extinction) ‚Üí GOD-S+ (cosmic existential).

SIREN SYSTEM:
Cities broadcast color-coded holographic alerts: üü¢ Human, üü° Beast, üî¥ Dragon, ‚ö´ God, ‚ö™ GOD+. God-level sirens force nationwide lockdown; monthly drills train citizens to shelter in subterranean domes.

2.content:
Elythria is divided by power, not wealth. 

GIFTED (‚âà95%): Idolized as society‚Äôs backbone; dominate politics, military and media. Families invest in academies and mentorships seeking hero careers or advanced research.

NULLS (‚â§5%): Born powerless. Marginalized yet vital ‚Äî they build the Siren Network, craft hero suits, and drive technological progress. The clandestine Null Resistance campaigns for equality; some splinter cells adopt sabotage.

SOCIAL VALUES:
‚Ä¢ Hero Worship: Heroes are celebrities and moral icons.
‚Ä¢ Power Stigma: Weak gifts are mocked; low-rankers face school ridicule.
‚Ä¢ Status Relationships: Couples judged by ‚Äúpower compatibility‚Äù; Null marriages are rare but symbolic acts of defiance.
‚Ä¢ Emotional Restraint: Children are taught to ‚Äúthink heroic,‚Äù masking fear in public.

EDUCATION:
Age-4 Gift Classification sorts students into: Power Academies (combat/control), Civic Academies (law/engineering/governance), and Null Institutes (research/industry). Career paths diverge sharply along these tracks.

3.content:
Villainy reflects the world‚Äôs imbalance ‚Äî from petty rogues to entities that bend reality.

ABYSSAL LEAGUE:
A covert network claiming the Agency is a tool of control. Cells act autonomously under A‚ÜíGOD+ leaders. Slogan: ‚ÄúTrue evolution requires breaking the cage.‚Äù

IDEOLOGIES:
‚Ä¢ Rule of Power ‚Äî strength defines destiny; morality is an illusion.
‚Ä¢ Broken Ideal ‚Äî fallen heroes seeking revenge on corruption.
‚Ä¢ Anarchs ‚Äî chaos as freedom; destroy hierarchy to rebuild.
‚Ä¢ Null Uprising ‚Äî radical Nulls sabotaging hero systems to force parity.

VILLAIN SOCIETY:
Hidden enclaves in abandoned zones; illegal broadcasts glorify villains as ‚Äòliberators.‚Äô

HIERARCHY:
F‚ÄìD (minor/rogue) ‚Üí C‚ÄìB (organized gangs) ‚Üí A‚ÄìS (regional warlords) ‚Üí SS‚ÄìSSS (global crises) ‚Üí GOD+ / GOD-S+ (worshipped, reality-warping).

4.content:
Auralis ‚Äî chrome spires, floating railways, holographic skies; 180M citizens under drone monitoring of Gifted power use. War scars (Void War fissures, memorial craters) remain as open museums.

DAILY LIFE & MEDIA:
Hero tournaments, reality broadcasts and talk shows dominate. Children play in VR arenas. Villain streams persist underground despite crackdowns.

MAJOR HOLIDAYS:
‚Ä¢ Day of Aether (Apr 15) ‚Äî Sky parades, holo-reenactments of Aetherius‚Äôs last stand, midnight silence.
‚Ä¢ Pyrelia‚Äôs Flame (Jul 7) ‚Äî Controlled flame festivals; couples exchange ‚Äòflame bracelets‚Äô as vows of courage.
‚Ä¢ Unity Day (Sep 21) ‚Äî Black banners; families release white lanterns citywide.
‚Ä¢ Eclipse Remembrance (Nov 9) ‚Äî Candle marches, night markets, open-air orchestras playing ‚ÄòSymphony of Dawn.‚Äô
‚Ä¢ Hero‚Äôs Legacy Day (Jan 10) ‚Äî Archives projection, memorial speeches, academy oath ceremonies.
‚Ä¢ Children of the Future (May 1) ‚Äî Youth exhibitions, simulation tournaments, mentorship talks by elites.
‚Ä¢ Null Week (unofficial) ‚Äî Activist fairs highlighting Null innovation; often censored but widely attended.

CIVIC RITUALS:
Monthly Siren Drills; annual Hero Parade for new Agency graduates.
